strategy: Replace the DNN with a random forest ensemble using gradient-boosted decision trees with added feature interactions via polynomial expansion. Instead of relying on dense transformations, introduce second-order polynomial features (e.g., age × fare, pclass × age) to capture nonlinear interactions that may be missed in linear or MLP models. Apply recursive feature elimination to select top 20 features and use out-of-bag (OOB) scoring for model evaluation. This approach leverages tree-based interactions while maintaining robustness to noisy features and handling missing values through median imputation.
